intro: Aster squarrosus, commonly known as the woolly aster, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is characterized by its fuzzy, grayish-blue foliage and showy, purple to pink flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological importance. Aster squarrosus is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 3 feet, making it a notable presence in its native environment.
